teams.name: Genealogists for Families
teams.loan_because:
we care about families (past, present and future).

'There are people trying to change this world that seems to be going down. Some people think there is nothing that can be done... But then there is you, who really do believe that it is still possible.'
teams.description:
Genealogists worldwide (plus relatives and friends) have found a simple way to help less fortunate families. In 2011 'Genealogists for Families' received an award for Best New Community Project.

Through Kiva, a non-profit organisation working with microfinance institutions, you choose a borrower to support with a loan of just $5 (through Kiva Zip) or $25 (on the main Kiva site). Similar loans by other lenders are combined until the required total is reached. This enables people without access to traditional banks (including many women) to expand their businesses, support and educate their children, save for the future and raise themselves out of poverty. As your money is repaid (often in monthly instalments), you can withdraw it or lend it to someone else. Money that is loaned over and over again does more good than a one-time donation!

Anyone *who makes a loan* through Kiva can be a member of this team. You can invite your family and friends to join even if they are not involved in genealogy.

** Please read http://genfamilies.blogspot.com/search/label/FAQ (which has important information and answers to frequently asked questions).

teams.loan_because: New York is full of entrepreneurs so we want to support others around the world, and give them the opportunity to alleviate themselves out of poverty.

teams.name: Fordham University
teams.description: Students, Faculty, Staff, Alumni & Friends of Fordham University

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.
teams.description: People who realize that if we switched places with the recipients, they'd loan to us just as happily.  So, fair's fair.

teams.name: women empowering women
teams.loan_because: empower a woman, change the world.

teams.name: Safe Girls Team
teams.loan_because: By empowering girls and women in the fight for women's rights, poverty reduction, education and health promotion, we are helping to create a fairer and better world for everyone.
teams.description:
This team supports the work of Kiva, improving the lives of people around the world who have limited financial means, and who would not otherwise have the means to improve their lives, those of their families, and their communities.

We also raise awareness of the issues of  violence against girls and women including fgm, education, maternal health and human rights.

This month we deal with the issue of Human Trafficking, a problem fuelled by poverty, and one which affects millions of women and children every year.

 A video explanation of what Trafficking is:

www.no-trafficking.org/

 A personal account:

http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/7243612.stm

Videos:

www.theguardian.com/global-development/audioslideshow/2013/dec/11/human-cost-sex-trafficking-prostitution-audio-slideshow

www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-18144333

This four week free of charge course on Human Trafficking begins on 20th August, 2014.

www.coursera.org/course/humantrafficking

 Detailed information about child trafficking:

www.childtrafficking.com/Content/sitemap.php

 To report a trafficking crime:

 In the USA:

www.fbi.gov/about-us/investigate/civilrights/human_trafficking

 In the UK:

https://crimestoppers-uk.org/get-involved/our-campaigns/national-campaigns/human-trafficking

Courses our team members might be interested in joining for free: 

Coursera:     
                                              
https://www.coursera.org/course/water 26th May, 2014

Edx:

Resilience https://www.edx.org/course/uwashingtonx/uwashingtonx-ecfs311x-becoming-resilient-1652#.UznR_Gco-M9  6th May,2014


We have been informed that “It is against Kiva’s terms of use http://www.kiva.org/legal/terms to use team message boards or personal lender pages for self-promotion or to solicit funding for things not related to Kiva.”

For anyone needing further information about Kiva's policy on people requesting money for themselves, other individuals or organisations on Kiva web pages please contact Kiva.

Safe Girls Team Captains.

teams.name: Tareto Maa
teams.description:
Tareto Maa is a grassroots nonprofit in Kenya, East Africa, whose objective is to empower the local community while eradicating the tradition of female genital mutilation (FGM) and child marriages within the Maasai people.  

The members of this Kiva group who are spokespersons of Tareto Maa are Gladys (TM Kenya), Jackie (TM USA), Philippe (TM Austria) and Armin (TM Germany). These members will publish project news on behalf of Tareto Maa. All other messages on the message board reflect private opinions of the group members.

The messages on the group’s board should discuss the work of Tareto Maa, further topics that relate to child rights, women's rights, community development, and the fight against gender-based violence, and also, of course, Kiva-related topics of all kinds.

For further information about Tareto Maa, please join our page on Facebook: www.facebook.com/TaretoMaa, or take a look at our WIKI: www.appropedia.org/Tareto_Maa 
This article describes why and how Tareto Maa was founded: http://worldpulse.com/node/62258

teams.description:

The goal of the Kiva Detroit team is to empower Detroiters to champion local small businesses through Kiva. 

To double your impact, your loan to a Kiva Detroit borrower will be matched 1-to-1 by the Knight Foundation

teams.name: Kedjan
teams.loan_because: Like the bike chain needs oil to run smoothly so does the world need Kiva.
teams.description:
The swedish word "Kedjan" means "the chain", and relates to the principle of how just a small amount of bike oil may turn a rusty bike chain into a well running one. Our team consider this as the principle for micro loans where a little amount of money can make people self supporting and create a well running business.
How much good can one rusty chain do? :)

teams.name: Nerdfighters
teams.loan_because:
We aim to decrease world suck.

And this is how:
www.eludehcs.no/kiva/nerdfighters/nerdfighters20120916.png by Nerdfighter Ole Bendik
teams.description:
We're Nerdfighters! We fight against suck; we fight for awesome! We fight using our brains, our hearts, our calculators, and our trombones.

Happy lending!

Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/KivaNerds

teams.name: Transpiral
teams.loan_because: For us at Transpiral, it’s important for us to give back. We believe when you enable one women you enable a family, a community and the next generation to make the world more awesome!

teams.loan_because: We Care!
teams.description: Just a group of friends/family wanting to help change the lives of people throughout the world to help alleviate poverty.

teams.name: Punahou School
teams.loan_because: Microloans are part of lesson of the Senior CapSEEDS course which stands for Social entrepreneurship, Economics, Environment, Deeds of service, and Sustainable solutions. Microloans are encompassed in attributes of the course therefore are essential to learning larger lessons.
teams.description: Seniors at Punahou School.  The team is only open to those of the Punahou community so if you do request to join, please indicate your connection to Punahou.  Mahalo

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.name: Kimberly and Peter's Wedding
teams.loan_because: We're excited to share the joy of our wedding with you, and maybe make the world a little bit better!
teams.description: We've been making loans on kiva.org for several years now. Honestly, we don't need that much more "stuff," and we thought that making a loan to some one in need in our honor would be a win-win-win scenario!

teams.name: 1Love Team
teams.loan_because: Everyone of us are made equal.What we make,we return it by helping others to live too.This world is made for all of us so everyone should have their equal chance at life.One Love.. :)
teams.description: "I believe in karma. What you give is what you get returned. I believe you can’t appreciate real love until you’ve been hurt. I believe the grass is greener on the other side. I believe you don’t know what you’ve got until you have to say goodbye. But the struggles make you stronger and the changes make you wise and happiness has it’s own way of taking it’s sweet time. Life isn’t always beautiful, but it’s a beautiful ride."

teams.name: University of Washington
teams.loan_because: This is a great way for a small individual effort have a huge impact for positive change and growth. Through microfinance and small-credit loans, we give others around the world the chance to realize their potential without removing the freedom of entrepreneurship and good business.
teams.description: The University of Washington (or UDub) is a large public university in Seattle, Washington committed to making a difference.

teams.loan_because: We can make a difference to others through improving ourselves.
teams.description: We are a team of people that are provide finance to Business based in Canberra, Australia.  We like KIVA because they do a similar thing with people less fortunate than our normal customers.  We argeed recently at an offsite that we would introduce a poor behaviour and poor language "fine", the proceeds of which could help other less fortunate to get a hand up in this world.

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.
teams.description: People who realize that if we switched places with the recipients, they'd loan to us just as happily.  So, fair's fair.

teams.name: Yemen Team
teams.loan_because: We want to empower people by giving them interest free (or very low interest) loans to help them achieve their goals.
teams.description: Members of this team like to help others by giving loans to anybody in the world, but with a special focus on Yemeni borrowers.

teams.name: Atheists, Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists and the Non-Religious
teams.loan_because: We care about human beings and understand that it takes people to help people.
teams.description:
We are one human family, and we know that people can do good without believing in a god.

The Plus sign in the A+ Team logo reflects the fact that the team comprises Atheists, PLUS Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists, and Non-Religious members.  A+ is also a symbol of excellence.

***TEAM WEBSITE***
http://apluskiva.wordpress.com/

***TEAM RESOURCES***
Secular Loans
http://goo.gl/wtDkJ

Field Partners - Social and Secular Ratings:
www.tinyurl.com/AASFSHNR-MFIs

***OTHER RESOURCES:***
Starfish List:
http://starfish.dynalias.org/

KivaLens:
http://www.kivalens.org/

teams.name: Nerdfighters
teams.loan_because:
We aim to decrease world suck.

And this is how:
www.eludehcs.no/kiva/nerdfighters/nerdfighters20120916.png by Nerdfighter Ole Bendik
teams.description:
We're Nerdfighters! We fight against suck; we fight for awesome! We fight using our brains, our hearts, our calculators, and our trombones.

Happy lending!

Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/KivaNerds

teams.name: Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster
teams.loan_because:
"Thou shalt share, that none may seek without funding."   A nod to VII.  of “RANDOM NUMBER OF NOT COMMANDMENTS, SUGGESTIONS"  in the LOOSE CANON:
http://www.loose-canon.info/page17.htm
teams.description:
Members of the Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster  

Secular vs religious Field Partners, see links at http://atheist-monkey.blogspot.de/2009/08/kiva-mfi-checker.html

For Kiva tips and who knows what the FSM will move us to add for mutual benefit & merriment:  
http://flyingspaghettikivans.blogspot.it/    

and
  https://www.facebook.com/pages/FlyingSpaghettiKivans

teams.name: Team CANADA
teams.loan_because:
So little means so much. And because we are so fortunate to be able to lend with the luxury of not worrying about whether we ever see that money again, while the clients borrow with the hope and determination that they will be able to repay, and improve their lives along the way.

Check out fundraising loans already being supported by Team Canada:
http://www.kiva.org/team/team_canada/loans?status=fundRaising
teams.description: We're Canadian, eh?

teams.name: Team Padfoot: In Memory of Claire Glass
Books For People
teams.loan_because: Loans that encourage literacy do as much for the community as the borrower.
teams.description: A team dedicated to lending money to book sellers, book binders, and other businesses that improve access to literacy and education.

teams.name: Trishula Bearer
teams.loan_because: We Care & Love to Share!
teams.description: Just helping those in Need.

teams.name: HALF THE SKY: Empowering Women
teams.loan_because: we believe empowering women is the key to alleviating social injustice and achieving world stability.
teams.description:
Inspired by the book HALF THE SKY written by Nicholas Kristof and Sheryl WuDunn, our team is committed to helping curb culturally accepted abuse of women around the world.

Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/HALFTHESKYEmpoweringWomenKIVATeam

teams.name: Robert Himler Foundation
teams.loan_because: As an entrepreneur myself I know how hard it can be getting new projects off the ground. Together let's empower the world with our loans to other like-minded, less fortunate individuals.
teams.description: Headed by Robert Himler. Let's help others together!

teams.description: Headed by currency traders Amy Sangster and Lewis Mocker, we encourage everyone to get on board and support those in need :)

teams.name: Kiva Christians
teams.loan_because:
Pure and undefiled religion before God the Father is this: to care for orphans and widows in their misfortune and to keep oneself unstained by the world. (Jam. 1:27) http://whoisjesus-really.com/

Link to information regarding Christian partners       
http://goo.gl/LU3hzz
teams.description: A group of believers in Jesus Christ, brought together through a common purpose: to help those in need around the world.

teams.loan_because: As an entrepreneur myself I know how hard it can be getting new projects off the ground. Together let's empower the world with our loans to other like-minded, less fortunate individuals.
teams.description: Headed by Robert Himler. Let's help others together!

teams.name: Pilipinas
teams.loan_because:
We CAN help our kababayans be financially independent.

Let us provide the nets so they can fish.
teams.description:
This is OUR CHANCE to GIVE OUR COUNTRYMEN A CHANCE!!!

Your $25 will go a long, long way to create livelihood opportunities for our kababayans. Let us help them help themselves. Let us empower them to help lift themselves out of poverty.  And ... YOU GET YOUR MONEY BACK because they will pay you back!

To find a Filipino entrepreneurs, click on the LEND button and just type in "Philippines" in the search field. There are always a few new entrepreneurs on a daily basis. But if you don't see one on that day. Try again the following day.

Lend - NOW!!!!

teams.name: Pakistan
teams.whereabouts: Pakistanis and friends of Pakistan worldwide!
teams.loan_because: We wish to encourage and support ambitious hard-working people all over Pakistan, in a dignified and empowering manner.
teams.description:
"If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion." - Dalai Lama

We are a group of generous, warm and benevolent individuals from all over the world, tackling poverty in Pakistan one loan at a time.

teams.name: Australia
teams.loan_because:
Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,
How can we let this be?    -   
We'll share our wealth,
We'll make the change,
We'll help to set them free   -   
From us to them
and back again, 
As one we all shall be      - 

(Thanks to member Jean for this one)

Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=97953452142
teams.description: Kiva Loaners in Australia

teams.name: GREEKERS
teams.loan_because: We believe environmental, social and economical sustainability goes hand in hand.
teams.description: GREEK (green geek) is a community of geeks: curious, creative, challenge loving individuals, who besides their talents are also environmentally inclined. For a Greeker an environmental problem is an opportunity to learn, explore and invent something: multidisciplinary, complex and innovative. GREEK is meant to bring together people from different fields, which share an environmental-social approach, who believe that many environmental problems can be addressed by creative thinking and a fresh approach. GREEK aspires to enable the development of environmental solutions from bottom-up (grass roots) - solutions that result from cooperation and open creative thinking processes.
